rules.natural: If a scientist studies a phenomenon, then plastic causes pollution.
Provided that a scientist publishes findings, pollution impacts wildlife follows.
Whenever a researcher collects data, a scientist studies a phenomenon.
Under the condition that a researcher analyzes data, a scientist publishes findings.

rules.prover9_expression: (testifies(person, committee) | (mobilizes(person, community) | (-(bans(legislation, plastic) | harmful(plastic)) -> passes(legislation, subsidy))))
rules.natural: Either a person testifies before the committee, or a person mobilizes the community, or if it is not the case that either legislation bans plastic or plastic is harmful, then legislation passes a subsidy.

rules.prover9_expression: (organizes(person, protest) | (-(amends(legislation, provision) -> passes(legislation, subsidy)) -> delays(process, vote)))
rules.natural: Either a person organizes a protest, or if it is not the case that if legislation amends a provision, then legislation passes a subsidy, then a process delays the vote.
Provided that plastic causes pollution, legislation bans plastic.
Under the condition that pollution impacts wildlife, plastic is harmful.
If it is not the case that either legislation bans plastic or plastic is harmful, then legislation amends a provision.
If it is not the case that either a researcher collects data or a researcher analyzes data, then a journal retracts a study.

facts.natural: A journal does not retract a study.
Legislation does not pass a subsidy.
A person does not mobilize the community.
A person does not testify before the committee.
A process does not delay the vote.
A person does not organize a protest.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either legislation bans plastic, or plastic is harmful.

(A10 → A8).natural: If a scientist studies a phenomenon, then plastic causes pollution.

(A10 ∨ A11).natural: Either a scientist studies a phenomenon, or a scientist publishes findings.

(A11 → A9).natural: Provided that a scientist publishes findings, pollution impacts wildlife follows.

(A12 → A10).natural: Whenever a researcher collects data, a scientist studies a phenomenon.

(A12 ∨ A13).natural: Either a researcher collects data, or a researcher analyzes data.

(A13 → A11).natural: Under the condition that a researcher analyzes data, a scientist publishes findings.

(A3 ∨ (¬(A1 ∨ G) → A2)).natural: Either a person mobilizes the community, or if it is not the case that either legislation bans plastic or plastic is harmful, then legislation passes a subsidy.

(A4 ∨ (A3 ∨ (¬(A1 ∨ G) → A2))).prover9_expression: (testifies(person, committee) | (mobilizes(person, community) | (-(bans(legislation, plastic) | harmful(plastic)) -> passes(legislation, subsidy))))
(A4 ∨ (A3 ∨ (¬(A1 ∨ G) → A2))).natural: Either a person testifies before the committee, or a person mobilizes the community, or if it is not the case that either legislation bans plastic or plastic is harmful, then legislation passes a subsidy.

(A5 → A2).natural: If legislation amends a provision, then legislation passes a subsidy.

(A7 ∨ (¬(A5 → A2) → A6)).prover9_expression: (organizes(person, protest) | (-(amends(legislation, provision) -> passes(legislation, subsidy)) -> delays(process, vote)))
(A7 ∨ (¬(A5 → A2) → A6)).natural: Either a person organizes a protest, or if it is not the case that if legislation amends a provision, then legislation passes a subsidy, then a process delays the vote.

(A8 → A1).natural: Provided that plastic causes pollution, legislation bans plastic.

(A8 ∨ A9).natural: Either plastic causes pollution, or pollution impacts wildlife.

(A9 → G).natural: Under the condition that pollution impacts wildlife, plastic is harmful.

(¬(A1 ∨ G) → A2).natural: If it is not the case that either legislation bans plastic or plastic is harmful, then legislation passes a subsidy.

(¬(A1 ∨ G) → A5).natural: If it is not the case that either legislation bans plastic or plastic is harmful, then legislation amends a provision.

(¬(A12 ∨ A13) → A14).natural: If it is not the case that either a researcher collects data or a researcher analyzes data, then a journal retracts a study.

(¬(A5 → A2) → A6).natural: If it is not the case that if legislation amends a provision, then legislation passes a subsidy, then a process delays the vote.

¬A14.natural: A journal does not retract a study.

¬A2.natural: Legislation does not pass a subsidy.

¬A3.natural: A person does not mobilize the community.

¬A4.natural: A person does not testify before the committee.

¬A6.natural: A process does not delay the vote.

¬A7.natural: A person does not organize a protest.
